verses.verse: Then <WG3767> truly <WG3303> the first <WG4413> covenant had <WG2192> also <WG2532> ordinances <WG1345> of divine <WG2999> service, <WG2999> and a worldly <WG2886> sanctuary. <WG39>

For there was a tabernacle <WG4633> made; <WG2680> the first, <WG4413> wherein <WG1722> <WG3757> was the candlestick, <WG3087> and the table, <WG5132> and the show bread; <WG4286> <WG740> which <WG3748> is called <WG3004> the sanctuary. <WG39>
And after <WG3326> the second <WG1208> veil, <WG2665> the tabernacle <WG4633> which <WG3588> is called <WG3004> the Holiest <WG39> of all;

Which had <WG2192> the golden <WG5552> censer, <WG2369> and the ark <WG2787> of the covenant <WG1242> overlaid <WG4028> round <WG3840> about <WG3840> with gold, <WG5553> wherein <WG1722> <WG3757> was the golden <WG5552> pot <WG4713> that had <WG2192> manna, <WG3131> and Aaron's <WG2> rod <WG4464> that budded, <WG985> and the tables <WG4109> of the covenant; <WG1242>

And over <WG5231> it the cherubim <WG5502> of glory <WG1391> shadowing <WG2683> the mercy seat; <WG2435> of which <WG3739> we cannot <WG3756> <WG1410> now <WG3568> speak <WG3004> particularly. <WG2596> <WG3313>

Now <WG1161> when these <WG5130> things were thus <WG3779> ordained, <WG2680> the priests <WG2409> went <WG1524> always <WG1275> into <WG1519> the first <WG4413> tabernacle, <WG4633> accomplishing <WG2005> the service <WG2999> of God.

But into <WG1519> the second <WG1208> went the high <WG749> priest <WG749> alone <WG3441> once <WG530> every year, <WG1763> not without <WG5565> blood, <WG129> which <WG3739> he offered <WG4374> for himself, <WG1438> and for the errors <WG51> of the people: <WG2992>

The Holy <WG40> Ghost <WG4151> this <WG5124> signifying, <WG1213> that the way <WG3598> into the holiest <WG39> of all was not yet <WG2089> made <WG5319> manifest, <WG5319> while as the first <WG4413> tabernacle <WG4633> was yet <WG2089> standing: <WG2192>

Which <WG3748> was a figure <WG3850> for the time <WG2540> then <WG3588> present, <WG1764> in which <WG3739> were offered both <WG5037> gifts <WG1435> and sacrifices, <WG2378> that could <WG1410> not make <WG5055> him that did <WG3000> the service <WG3000> perfect, <WG5048> as pertaining to the conscience; <WG4893>

Which stood only <WG3440> in meats <WG1033> and drinks, <WG4188> and divers <WG1313> washings, <WG909> and carnal <WG4561> ordinances, <WG1345> imposed <WG1945> on them until <WG3360> the time <WG2540> of reformation. <WG1357>

But Christ <WG5547> being come <WG3854> an high <WG749> priest <WG749> of good <WG18> things to come, <WG3195> by a greater <WG3187> and more perfect <WG5046> tabernacle, <WG4633> not made <WG5499> with hands, <WG5499> that is to say, not of this <WG5026> building; <WG2937>

Neither <WG3761> by the blood <WG129> of goats <WG5131> and calves, <WG3448> but by his own <WG2398> blood <WG129> he entered <WG1525> in once <WG2178> into <WG1519> the holy <WG39> place, having obtained <WG2147> eternal <WG166> redemption <WG3085> for us.

For if <WG1487> the blood <WG129> of bulls <WG5022> and of goats, <WG5131> and the ashes <WG4700> of an heifer <WG1151> sprinkling <WG4472> the unclean, <WG2840> sanctifies <WG37> to the purifying <WG2514> of the flesh: <WG4561>

How <WG4214> much <WG4214> more <WG3123> shall the blood <WG129> of Christ, <WG5547> who <WG3739> through <WG1223> the eternal <WG166> Spirit <WG4151> offered <WG4374> himself <WG1438> without <WG299> spot <WG299> to God, <WG2316> purge <WG2511> your <WG5216> conscience <WG4893> from dead <WG3498> works <WG2041> to serve <WG3000> the living <WG2198> God? <WG2316>

And for this <WG5124> cause <WG1223> he is the mediator <WG3316> of the new <WG2537> testament, <WG1242> that by means <WG1096> of death, <WG2288> for the redemption <WG629> of the transgressions <WG3847> that were under <WG1909> the first <WG4413> testament, <WG1242> they which are called <WG2564> might receive <WG2983> the promise <WG1860> of eternal <WG166> inheritance. <WG2817>
For where <WG3699> a testament <WG1242> is, there must also of necessity <WG318> be the death <WG2288> of the testator. <WG1303>

For a testament <WG1242> is of force <WG949> after men are dead: <WG3498> otherwise <WG1893> it is of no <WG3361> strength <WG2480> at <WG3379> all <WG4219> while <WG3753> the testator <WG1303> lives. <WG2198>
Whereupon <WG3606> neither <WG3761> the first <WG4413> testament was dedicated <WG1457> without <WG5565> blood. <WG129>

For when Moses <WG3475> had spoken <WG2980> every <WG3956> precept <WG1785> to all <WG3956> the people <WG2992> according <WG2596> to the law, <WG3551> he took <WG2983> the blood <WG129> of calves <WG3448> and of goats, <WG5131> with water, <WG5204> and scarlet <WG2847> wool, <WG2053> and hyssop, <WG5301> and sprinkled <WG4473> both <WG5037> the book, <WG975> and all <WG3956> the people, <WG2992>
Saying, <WG3004> This <WG5124> is the blood <WG129> of the testament <WG1242> which <WG3739> God <WG2316> has enjoined <WG1781> to you.
Moreover <WG1161> he sprinkled <WG4473> with blood <WG129> both <WG2532> the tabernacle, <WG4633> and all <WG3956> the vessels <WG4632> of the ministry. <WG3009>
And almost <WG4975> all <WG3956> things are by the law <WG3551> purged <WG2511> with blood; <WG129> and without <WG5565> shedding <WG130> of blood <WG130> is no <WG3756> remission. <WG859>

It was therefore <WG3767> necessary <WG318> that the patterns <WG5262> of things in the heavens <WG3772> should be purified <WG2511> with these; <WG5125> but the heavenly <WG2032> things themselves <WG846> with better <WG2909> sacrifices <WG2378> than <WG3844> these. <WG5025>

For Christ <WG5547> is not entered <WG1525> into <WG1519> the holy <WG39> places made <WG5499> with hands, <WG5499> which are the figures <WG499> of the true; <WG228> but into <WG1519> heaven <WG3772> itself, <WG846> now <WG3568> to appear <WG1718> in the presence <WG4383> of God <WG2316> for us:

Nor <WG3761> yet that he should offer <WG4374> himself <WG1438> often, <WG4178> as the high <WG749> priest <WG749> enters <WG1535> into <WG1519> the holy <WG39> place every <WG2596> year <WG1763> with blood <WG129> of others; <WG245>

For then must <WG1163> he often <WG4178> have suffered <WG3958> since <WG575> the foundation <WG2602> of the world: <WG2889> but now <WG3568> once <WG530> in the end <WG4930> of the world <WG165> has he appeared <WG5319> to put <WG115> away <WG115> sin <WG266> by the sacrifice <WG2378> of himself. <WG848>
And as it is appointed <WG606> to men <WG444> once <WG530> to die, <WG599> but after <WG3326> this <WG5124> the judgment: <WG2920>

So <WG3779> Christ <WG5547> was once <WG530> offered <WG4374> to bear <WG399> the sins <WG266> of many; <WG4183> and to them that look <WG553> for him shall he appear <WG3700> the second <WG1208> time without <WG5565> sin <WG266> to salvation. <WG4991>
